content.en: Spine disease classification: Researchers have developed algorithms that can assess and classify various aspects of degenerative spine diseases using routine magnetic resonance imaging (MRI). These algorithms provide new techniques for evaluating intervertebral disc degeneration, including T2 mapping, T2* mapping, and spin-spin relaxation time (T2) cut-off values. Additionally, computer-aided classification software has been developed to assist in the detection and classification of lumbar spine diseases. These advancements aim to improve the accuracy and standardization of MRI findings for degenerative spine diseases.
content.da: Rygsygdomsklassifikation: Forskere har udviklet algoritmer, der kan vurdere og klassificere forskellige aspekter af degenerative ryglidelser ved hjælp af rutinemæssig magnetisk resonansafbildning (MRI). Disse algoritmer giver nye teknikker til vurdering af diskusdegeneration, herunder T2 mapping, T2* mapping og spin-spin-relaxationstid (T2) cut-off værdier. Desuden er der udviklet computerstøttet klassifikationssoftware til at hjælpe med at opdage og klassificere lumbal ryglidelser. Disse fremskridt sigter mod at forbedre nøjagtigheden og standardiseringen af MRI-resultater for degenerative ryglidelser.
